page.title: 10Employment-Ringland Taverham
page.content: In the 1981 census, 8.33% of {Ringland's}population of 170 were unemployed. Out of 112{Taverham}adults interviewed, 17 work locally, 2 are unemployed and 88 work in Norwich. {Atlas Aggregate, Ayton Asphalt and May {Gurney's}are large firms based at the gravel pits. A plastic surgeon works from home in Ringland Lane and there is a cattery. There is 1 shop in {Ringland}but vans bring milk, bread, wet fish, fish & chips and the mobile library. {Mr.Royal}is a silversmith and wood carver. He had to pay Â£20 to be apprenticed to A.Bretts, a well known old Norwich firm in the 1930s. He is now helped by{Mr Margerum}in their business of restoring & making antique & reproduction furniture for home and export markets in the Old School. They are renowned for church restorations.
